definition: to perform divination with sticks/to draw lots/a ballot (in share dealing)
to draw out/to pull out from in between/to remove part of the whole/(of certain plants) to sprout or bud/to whip or thrash
to sign one's name/visa/variant of 籤|签[qian1]
inscribed bamboo stick (used in divination, gambling, drawing lots etc)/small wood sliver/label/tag

sentences.english: Groupings in the preliminary round will be determined by the organizer.
sentences.chinese: 初赛分组由大会抽签决定。

sentences.english: First, cast lots, then prepare and act.
sentences.chinese: 各组先抽顺序，然后按抽签顺序准备表演。

sentences.english: A computer-generated random lottery drawing chooses selectees for diversity visas.
sentences.chinese: 该计划由电脑随机性抽签选取申请人。

sentences.english: The weighing-in will be conducted before the drawing-lots after the competitors' arrival.
sentences.chinese: 运动员报到后先称量体重，然后抽签进行编排。

sentences.english: They drew lots to decide who should be their spokesman.
sentences.chinese: 他们抽签决定谁是他们的发言人。

sentences.english: She was unlucky enough to draw kitchen cleanup twice in one week.
sentences.chinese: 她够倒霉的，在一周内两次抽签得下厨打扫。

sentences.english: There is no fee for entering the lottery or downloading and completing the application form.
sentences.chinese: 参加此项抽签或下载并填写申请表格无需交费。

sentences.english: They part my garments among them, and cast lots upon my vesture .
sentences.chinese: 他们彼此分了我的外衣，又为我的内衣抽签。

sentences.english: In that draw lots , he became a night king.
sentences.chinese: 在那次抽签中，他成为了冥王。

sentences.english: "The house is being raffled off, " Hart said.
sentences.chinese: “房子要被抽签出售咯”海特说道。

sentences.english: When the draw is made for home and away games, we get away ones on Wednesdays.
sentences.chinese: 当抽签决定主客场时，我们在周三都被抽中客场比赛。

sentences.english: And they cast lots equally, both little and great, by their families for every one of the gates.
sentences.chinese: 他们不论大小，按照他们的家族抽签，看守各门。

sentences.english: What about the lottery idea? Does that count as consent?
sentences.chinese: 那抽签那个主意呢，能被视作为同意吗？

sentences.english: Visa applicants are selected through a computer-generated, random lottery.
sentences.chinese: 中签者由电脑随机抽签产生。

sentences.english: Participants will be notified when lottery results are available, and the payment process will be handled by the Bank of China.
sentences.chinese: 抽签结果会通知购票者，付款程序将由中国银行负责。

sentences.english: One won and the other lost; that's the luck of the draw.
sentences.chinese: 有人赢就有人输，抽签全靠运气。

definition: to divide into groups/(computer networking) packet
host/official host (e.g. venue for games or a conference)
(sports) to go out of bounds/to go over the line/to qualify for the next round of competition/(Tw) (fig.) to make the grade/to achieve success
to win (a prize in a lottery)
